data.text: @ErichVonDanike1 Thanks for the info tho bud.. 😏😌

@ErichVonDanike1 So, I read this article, and I defoliated imagine the early stages, and took handfuls of weed off the plants, but after the first two-three weeks of flowering you shouldn’t defoliate them. If you pick off big fan leaves, during flower it could stunt your bud..
@MyLilBeauty1 I see... the light from the grow spectrum gives an interesting coloration as well.
@Ray00260274 Lol, my fiancé.. haha he she a severe mail chewing issues..
@ErichVonDanike1 I’ll take a look for sure..

@MyLilBeauty1 It’s nice to let them go at least 8-10 weeks in flower and even longer if they’re vibrant ☺️I’ve had some go for 17 weeks and they were put on flush only at week 11 👀 I just didn’t have the heart to take them down as long as they were bursting out so nice 🤷‍♂️
@MyLilBeauty1 Good looking flowers you have there, now about the not my fingers bit???
@MyLilBeauty1 Lil beauty's for a lil beauty...
@MyLilBeauty1 It definitely works it changed the game for me. Each to there own but here's a bacic summery of how it works.
